Name: Pound
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Karate Chop
Effect: Has a high critical hit ratio.

Name: Double Slap
Effect: Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice a 3/8 chance to hit three times a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times. If the user of this move has Skill Link this move will always strike five times.

Name: Comet Punch
Effect: Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice a 3/8 chance to hit three times a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times. If the user of this move has Skill Link this move will always strike five times.

Name: Mega Punch
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Pay Day
Effect: The player picks up extra money after in-game battles; the money received is equal to: [user's level * 5 * number of times Pay Day is used]. The player does not lose money if the opponent uses Pay Day but the player wins the battle.

Name: Fire Punch
Effect: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Name: Ice Punch
Effect: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

Name: Thunder Punch

Name: Gust

Name: Whirlwind
Effect: Almost always goes last; in trainer battles the target is switched out for a random member of its team. Escapes from wild battles. Has no effect if the target has Suction Cups or used Ingrain.

Name: Fly

Gust Twister Thunder and Sky Uppercut have normal accuracy against a mid-air Pokemon with Gust and Twister also gaining doubled power. The user may also be hit in mid-air if it was previously targeted by Lock-On or Mind Reader or if it is attacked by a Pokemon with No Guard. On the second turn the user attacks.

Name: Bind
Effect: Traps the target for 5-6 turns causing damage equal to 1/16 of its max HP each turn; this trapped effect can be broken by Rapid Spin. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-Turn.

Name: Slam
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Vine Whip
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Stomp
Effect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch; also retains its normal accuracy and gains doubled power against Minimized Pokemon.

Name: Double Kick
Effect: Strikes twice; if the first hit breaks the target's Substitute the real Pokemon will take damage from the second hit.

Name: Mega Kick
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Jump Kick

Effect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Effect: Lowers the target's Accuracy by 1 stage.

Effect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Effect: Lowers the target's Defense by 1 stage.

Effect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Effect: Lowers the target's Attack by 1 stage.

Effect: Almost always goes last; in trainer battles the target is switched out for a random member of its team. Escapes from wild battles. Has no effect if the target has Suction Cups Soundproof or used Ingrain.

Effect: Puts the target to sleep.

Effect: Confuses the target.

Name: Sonic Boom
Effect: Always deals 20 points of damage.

Name: Disable
Effect: The target cannot choose its last move for 4-7 turns. Disable only works on one move at a time and fails if the target has not yet used a move or if its move has run out of PP. The target does nothing if it is about to use a move that becomes disabled.

Name: Acid
Effect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Ember
Effect: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Name: Flamethrower
Effect: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Name: Mist
Effect: Protects every Pokemon on the user's team from negative stat modifiers caused by other Pokemon (including teammates) but not by itself for five turns. The team's Accuracy and Evasion stats are also protected. Moves that cause negative stat modifiers as a secondary effect such as Psychic still deal their regular damage.

Name: Water Gun
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Hydro Pump
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Surf
Effect: Power doubles against a target who is in the middle of using Dive.

Name: Ice Beam
Effect: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

Name: Blizzard
Effect: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target. During Hail this move will never miss under normal circumstances and has a 30% chance to hit through a target's Protect or Detect.

Name: Psybeam
Effect: Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

Name: Bubble Beam
Effect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.

Name: Aurora Beam
Effect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Attack by 1 stage.

Name: Hyper Beam

Name: Peck
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Drill Peck
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Submission
Effect: The user receives 1/4 recoil damage.

Name: Low Kick

Name: Counter
Effect: Almost always goes last; if an opponent strikes with a Physical attack before the user's turn the user retaliates for twice the damage it had endured. In double battles this attack targets the last opponent to hit the user with a Physical attack and cannot hit the user's teammate.

Name: Seismic Toss
Effect: Does damage equal to user's level.

Name: Strength
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Absorb
Effect: Restores the user's HP by 1/2 of the damage inflicted on the target.

Name: Mega Drain
Effect: Restores the user's HP by 1/2 of the damage inflicted on the target.

Name: Leech Seed
Effect: The user steals 1/8 of the target's max HP until the target is switched out is KO'ed or uses Rapid Spin; does not work against Grass-type Pokemon or Pokemon behind Substitutes.

Name: Growth
Effect: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage. If the weather is Sun Growth raises Attack and SpAttk two stages each.

Name: Razor Leaf
Effect: Has a high critical hit ratio.

Name: Solar Beam
Effect: The user prepares on turn one becoming uncontrollable and then attacks on turn two. During Sunny Day this move fires immediately; during Rain Dance Sandstorm and Hail this move has half power.

Effect: Poisons the target.

Effect: Paralyzes the target.

Name: Sleep Powder
Effect: Puts the target to sleep.

Name: Petal Dance
Effect: The user attacks uncontrollably for 2-3 turns and then gets confused.

Name: String Shot
Effect: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 stage.

Name: Dragon Rage
Effect: Always deals 40 points of damage.

Name: Fire Spin
Effect: Traps the target for 5-6 turns causing damage equal to 1/16 of its max HP each turn; this trapped effect can be broken by Rapid Spin. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or it uses U-Turn.

Name: Thunder Shock
Effect: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

Name: Thunderbolt
Effect: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

Name: Thunder Wave
Effect: Paralyzes the target. This move activates Motor Drive.

Name: Thunder
Effect: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target. It also has normal accuracy against mid-air Pokemon who have used Fly or Bounce. During Sunny Day this move has 50% accuracy. During Rain Dance this move will never miss under normal circumstances and has a 30% chance to hit through a target's Protect or Detect.

Name: Rock Throw
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Earthquake
Effect: Power doubles when performed against Pokemon using Dig.

Name: Fissure
Effect: The target faints; doesn't work on higher-leveled Pokemon.

Name: Dig
Effect: On the first turn the user digs underground becoming uncontrollable and evades all attacks. Earthquake and Magnitude can hit underground and gain doubled power. The user may also be hit underground if it was previously targeted by Lock-On or Mind Reader or if it is attacked by a Pokemon with No Guard. On the second turn the user attacks.

Name: Toxic
Effect: The target is badly poisoned with the damage caused by poison doubling after each turn. Toxic poisoning will remain with the Pokemon during the battle even after switching out.

Name: Confusion
Effect: Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

Name: Psychic
Effect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Hypnosis
Effect: Puts the target to sleep.

Name: Meditate
Effect: Raises the user's Attack by 1 stage.

Name: Agility
Effect: Raises the user's Speed by 2 stages.

Name: Quick Attack
Effect: Usually goes first.

Name: Rage
Effect: The user's Attack rises by 1 stage if attacked before its next move.

Name: Teleport
Effect: Escapes from wild battles; fails automatically in trainer and link battles.

Name: Night Shade
Effect: Does damage equal to user's level.

Name: Mimic
Effect: This move is temporarily replaced by the target's last move; the replacement move will have 5 PP and become part of the user's moveset until the user switches out or the battle ends. Mimic copies attacks even if they miss or the user has immunity toward their type; it cannot copy itself Struggle Transform Sketch Metronome or moves that the user already knows and it will fail if the target has yet to use a move.

Name: Screech
Effect: Lowers the target's Defense by 2 stages.

Name: Double Team
Effect: Raises the user's Evasion by 1 stage.

Name: Recover
Effect: Restores 1/2 of the user's max HP.

Name: Harden
Effect: Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Minimize
Effect: Raises the user's Evasion by 2 stage; however Stomp retains its normal accuracy and gains doubled power against Minimized Pokemon.

Name: Smokescreen
Effect: Lowers the target's Accuracy by 1 stage.

Name: Confuse Ray
Effect: Confuses the target.

Name: Withdraw
Effect: Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Defense Curl
Effect: Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage; after one use of this move the user's starting base power is doubled for every use of Rollout or Ice Ball.

Name: Barrier
Effect: Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.

Name: Light Screen
Effect: All Pokemon in the user's party receive 1/2 damage from Special attacks for 5 turns. Light Screen will be removed from the user's field if an opponent's Pokemon uses Brick Break. It will also last for eight turns if its user is holding Light Clay. In double battles both Pokemon are shielded but damage protection is reduced from 1/2 to 1/3.

Name: Haze
Effect: Eliminates any stat modifiers from all active Pokemon. The stat boosts from Choice Band Choice Lens and Choice Scarf are not affected.

Name: Reflect
Effect: All Pokemon in the user's party receive 1/2 damage from Physical attacks for 5 turns. Reflect will be removed from the user's field if an opponent's Pokemon uses Brick Break. It will also last for eight turns if its user is holding Light Clay. In double battles both Pokemon are shielded but damage protection is reduced from 1/2 to 1/3.

Name: Focus Energy
Effect: Raises the user's chance for a Critical Hit by two domains.

Name: Bide
Effect: Usually goes first for the duration of the move. The user absorbs all damage for two turns and then during the third turn the user inflicts twice the absorbed damage on its target. This move ignores the target's type and even hits Ghost-type Pokemon.

Name: Metronome
Effect: The user performs a randomly selected move; almost any move in the game could be picked. Metronome cannot generate itself Assist Chatter Copycat Counter Covet Destiny Bond Detect Endure Feint Focus Punch Follow Me Helping Hand Me First Mimic Mirror Coat Mirror Move Protect Sketch Sleep Talk Snatch Struggle Switcheroo Thief Trick or any move that the user already knows.

Name: Mirror Move
Effect: The user performs the last move executed by its target; if applicable an attack's damage is calculated with the user's stats level and type(s). This moves fails if the target has not yet used a move. Mirror Move cannot copy Encore Struggle global moves affecting all Pokemon on the field (such as Gravity Hail Rain Dance Sandstorm and Sunny Day) moves that can bypass Protect (Acupressure Doom Desire Future Sight Imprison Perish Song Psych Up Role Play and Transform) and moves that do not have a specific target (such as Light Screen Reflect Safeguard Spikes Stealth Rock and Toxic Spikes).

Name: Self-Destruct
Effect: Causes the user to faint.

Name: Egg Bomb
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Lick
Effect: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

Effect: Has a 40% chance to poison the target.

Effect: Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

Effect: Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

Effect: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Effect: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

Effect: Traps the target for 5-6 turns causing damage equal to 1/16 of its max HP each turn; this trapped effect can be broken by Rapid Spin. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-Turn.

Name: Swift
Effect: Ignores Evasion and Accuracy modifiers and never misses except against Protect Detect or a target in the middle of Dig Fly Dive or Bounce.

Name: Skull Bash
Effect: The user prepares on turn one raising its Defense by 1 stage and becoming uncontrollable and then attacks on turn two.

Name: Spike Cannon
Effect: Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice a 3/8 chance to hit three times a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times. If the user of this move has Skill Link this move will always strike five times.

Effect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.

Effect: Raises the user's Special Defense by 2 stages.

Effect: Lowers the target's Accuracy by 1 stage.

Effect: Restores 1/2 of the user's max HP.

Name: High Jump Kick
Effect: If this attack misses the target the user half of its max health in recoil damage.

Name: Glare
Effect: Paralyzes the target.

Name: Dream Eater
Effect: Restores the user's HP by 1/2 of the damage inflicted on the target but only works on a sleeping target.

Name: Poison Gas
Effect: Poisons the target.

Name: Barrage
Effect: Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice a 3/8 chance to hit three times a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times. If the user of this move has Skill Link this move will always strike five times.

Name: Leech Life
Effect: Restores the user's HP by 1/2 of the damage inflicted on the target.

Name: Lovely Kiss
Effect: Puts the target to sleep.

Name: Sky Attack
Effect: The user prepares on turn one becoming uncontrollable and then attacks on turn two. Also has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Name: Transform
Effect: The user morphs into a near-exact copy of the target. Stats stat modifiers type moves Hidden Power data and appearance are changed; the user's level and HP remain the same and each copied move receives only 5 PP. (If Transform is used by Ditto the effects of Metal Powder and Quick Powder stop working after transformation.)

Name: Bubble
Effect: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.

Name: Dizzy Punch
Effect: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

Name: Spore
Effect: Puts the target to sleep.

Name: Flash
Effect: Lowers the target's Accuracy by 1 stage.

Name: Psywave
Effect: Randomly inflicts set damage equal to .5x .6x .7x .8x .9x 1.0x 1.1x 1.2x 1.3x 1.4x or 1.5x the user's level.

Name: Splash
Effect: Doesn't do anything (but we still love it). Unfortunately it also cannot be used during the effects of Gravity! :(

Name: Acid Armor
Effect: Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.

Name: Crabhammer
Effect: Has a high critical hit ratio.

Name: Explosion
Effect: Causes the user to faint.

Name: Fury Swipes
Effect: Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice a 3/8 chance to hit three times a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times. If the user of this move has Skill Link this move will always strike five times.

Name: Bonemerang
Effect: Strikes twice; if the first hit breaks the target's Substitute the real Pokemon will take damage from the second hit.

Name: Rest
Effect: The user is cured of status effects (and confusion) and recovers full HP but falls asleep for 2 turns. Pokemon who have Early Bird will wake up one turn early.

Name: Rock Slide
Effect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Name: Hyper Fang
Effect: Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

Name: Sharpen
Effect: Raises the user's Attack by 1 stage.

Name: Conversion
Effect: The user's type changes to match the type of one of its four attacks. This move fails if the user cannot change its type under this condition.

Name: Tri Attack
Effect: Has a 20% chance to burn paralyze or freeze the target.

Name: Super Fang
Effect: This move halves the target's current HP.

Name: Slash
Effect: Has a high critical hit ratio.

Name: Substitute
Effect: The user takes one-fourth of its maximum HP to create a substitute; this move fails if the user does not have enough HP for this. Until the substitute is broken it receives damage from all attacks made by other Pokemon and shields the user from status effects and stat modifiers caused by other Pokemon. The user is still affected by Tickle Hail Sandstorm and Attract from behind its Substitute. If a Substitute breaks from a hit during a multistrike move such as Fury Attack the user takes damage from the remaining strikes.

Name: Struggle
Effect: Used automatically when all of the user's other moves have run out of PP or are otherwise inaccessible. The user receives recoil damage equal to 1/4 of its max HP. Struggle is classified as a typeless move and will hit any Pokemon for normal damage.

Name: Sketch
Effect: The user permanently replaces Sketch with the last move used by the target. Sketch cannot copy itself Chatter Memento or Struggle. Transform and moves that generate other moves can be Sketched successfully as can Explosion and Selfdestruct if a Pokemon with Damp is present. Healing Wish and Lunar Dance can be Sketched because they automatically fail when the user is the last Pokemon of its team. This move fails automatically when selected in wireless or Wi-Fi battles.

Name: Triple Kick
Effect: Attacks three times in one turn adding 10 BP for each kick. If a kick misses the move ends instantly; if one of the kicks breaks a target's Substitute the real Pokemon will take damage for the remaining kicks.

Name: Thief
Effect: Steals the target's held item unless the user is already holding an item or the target has Sticky Hold or Multitype. A stolen item cannot be recovered by using Recycle.

Name: Spider Web
Effect: As long as the user remains in battle the target cannot switch out unless it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-Turn. The target will still be trapped if the user switches out by using Baton Pass.

Name: Mind Reader
Effect: This move ensures that the user's next attack will hit against its current target. This effect can be Baton Passed to another Pokemon. Mind Reader fails against Pokemon in the middle of using Protect Detect Dig Fly Bounce or Dive as well as Pokemon behind a Substitute. If the target uses Protect or Detect during its next turn the user's next move has a [100 Varmove's normal accuracy]% chance to hit through Protect or Detect. OHKO moves do not benefit from this trait.

Name: Nightmare
Effect: This move only works on a sleeping target; as long as the target remains asleep and in battle 1/4 of its max HP is sapped after each turn.

Name: Flame Wheel
Effect: Has a 10% chance to burn the target; can be used while frozen which both attacks the target normally and thaws the user.

Name: Snore
Effect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch; fails if user is awake.

Name: Curse
Effect: When used by a Ghost-type the user sacrifices half of its max HP to sap the target by 1/4 of its max HP per turn. When used by anything else the user's Speed is decreased by 1 stage and its Attack and Defense are increased by 1 stage.

Name: Flail
Effect: Base power increases as the user's HP decreases.

Name: Conversion 2
Effect: The user's type changes to one that resists the type of the last attack that hit the user. In double battles this situation holds even when the user is last hit by an attack from its partner.

Name: Aeroblast
Effect: Has a high critical hit ratio.

Name: Cotton Spore
Effect: Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.

Name: Reversal
Effect: Base power increases as the user's HP decreases.

Name: Spite
Effect: The target's most recent move is reduced by 4 PP; this fails if the target has not yet performed a move if the target's last move has run out of PP or if the target can only use Struggle.

Name: Powder Snow
Effect: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

Name: Protect
Effect: Almost always goes first. The user is protected from all attacks for one turn but the move's success rate halves with each consecutive use of Protect Detect or Endure. If a Pokemon has No Guard or used Lock-On or Mind Reader against the user during the previous turn its attack has a [100 Varmove's normal accuracy]% chance to hit through Protect; OHKO moves do not benefit from this effect. Blizzard has a 30% to hit through this move during Hail as does Thunder during Rain Dance.

Name: Mach Punch
Effect: Usually goes first.

Name: Scary Face
Effect: Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.

Name: Feint Attack
Effect: Ignores Evasion and Accuracy modifiers and never misses except against Protect Detect or a target in the middle of Dig Fly Dive or Bounce.

Name: Sweet Kiss
Effect: Confuses the target.

Name: Belly Drum
Effect: The user maximizes its Attack but sacrifices 50% of its max HP.

Name: Sludge Bomb
Effect: Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

Name: Mud-Slap
Effect: Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Accuracy by 1 stage.

Name: Octazooka
Effect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Accuracy by 1 stage.

Name: Spikes
Effect: Damages opponents unless they are Flying-type or have Levitate every time they are switched in; hits through Wonder Guard. Can be used up to three times: saps 1/8 of max HP with one layer 3/16 of max HP with two layers and 1/4 of max HP for three layers.

Name: Zap Cannon
Effect: Paralyzes the target.

Name: Foresight
Effect: Until the target faints or switches the user's Accuracy modifiers and the target's Evasion modifiers are ignored. Ghost-type targets also lose their immunities against Normal-type and Fighting-type moves.

Name: Destiny Bond
Effect: Causes an opponent to faint if its next attack KOs the user.

Name: Perish Song
Effect: All active Pokemon will faint in 3 turns unless they are switched out.

Name: Icy Wind
Effect: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 stage.

Name: Detect
Effect: Almost always goes first. The user is protected from all attacks for one turn but the move's success rate halves with each consecutive use of Protect Detect or Endure. If a Pokemon has No Guard or used Lock-On or Mind Reader against the user during the previous turn its attack has a [100 Varmove's normal accuracy]% chance to hit through Detect; OHKO moves do not benefit from this effect. Blizzard has a 30% to hit through this move during Hail as does Thunder during Rain Dance.

Name: Bone Rush
Effect: Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice a 3/8 chance to hit three times a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times. If the user of this move has Skill Link this move will always strike five times.

Name: Lock-On
Effect: This move ensures that the user's next attack will hit against its current target. This effect can be Baton Passed to another Pokemon. Lock-On fails against Pokemon in the middle of using Protect Detect Dig Fly Bounce or Dive as well as Pokemon behind a Substitute. If the target uses Protect or Detect during its next turn the user's next move has a [100 Varmove's normal accuracy]% chance to hit through Protect or Detect. OHKO moves do not benefit from this trait.

Name: Outrage
Effect: The user attacks uncontrollably for 2-3 turns and then gets confused.

Name: Sandstorm
Effect: Cancels all other weather moves. For 5 turns: the Special Defense of Rock-type Pokemon is boosted by 50% each active Pokemon even when protected by a Substitute loses 1/16 of its max HP unless it has Sand Veil or is a Ground- Rock- or Steel-type the power of Solarbeam is halved and the healing power of Morning Sun Synthesis and Moonlight is halved. The effects of Sandstorm will last for eight turns if its user is holding Smooth Rock.

Name: Giga Drain
Effect: Restores the user's HP by 1/2 of the damage inflicted on the target.

Name: Endure
Effect: Almost always goes first. The user is left with at least 1 HP following any attacks for one turn but the move's success rate halves with each consecutive use of Protect Detect or Endure.

Name: Charm
Effect: Lowers the target's Attack by 2 stages.

Name: Rollout
Effect: The user attacks uncontrollably for five turns; this move's power doubles after each turn and also if Defense Curl was used beforehand. Its power resets after five turns have ended or if the attack misses.

Name: False Swipe
Effect: Leaves the target with at least 1 HP.

Name: Swagger
Effect: Confuses the target and raises its Attack by 2 stages.

Name: Milk Drink
Effect: Restores 1/2 of the user's max HP.

Name: Spark
Effect: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

Name: Fury Cutter
Effect: The base power of this move doubles with each consecutive hit; however power is capped at a maximum 160 BP and remains there for any subsequent uses. If this move misses base power will be reset to 10 BP on the next turn. The user can also select other attacks without resetting this move's power; it will continue to double after each use until it either misses or reaches the 160 BP cap.

Name: Steel Wing
Effect: Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Mean Look
Effect: As long as the user remains in battle the target cannot switch out unless it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-Turn. The target will still be trapped if the user switches out by using Baton Pass.

Name: Attract
Effect: Infatuates Pokemon of the opposite gender even if they have a Substitute causing a 50% chance for the target's attack to fail.

Name: Sleep Talk
Effect: Does nothing if the user is awake. If the user asleep it randomly performs one of its attacks. Rest will fail if it is selected. Sleep Talk's generated attacks do not cost PP but it cannot generate moves with 0 PP itself Assist Bide Chatter Copycat Disabled attacks Focus Punch Me First Metronome Mirror Move Uproar or attacks with a charge-up turn like Fly or Skull Bash. (Moves with a recharge turn like Hyper Beam can be generated.)

Name: Heal Bell
Effect: Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of status conditions. Allied Pokemon who have Soundproof are not affected.

Name: Return
Effect: Power increases as user's happiness increases; maximum 102 BP.

Name: Present
Effect: Randomly either attacks with a variable power between 40 base power and 120 base power or heals the target by 80 HP.

Name: Frustration
Effect: Power increases as user's happiness decreases; maximum 102 BP.

Name: Safeguard
Effect: Protects the user's entire team from status conditions for five turns.

Name: Pain Split
Effect: Calculates the average of the user's current HP and the target's HP; the HP of both Pokemon is set to this average. Pokemon can be healed by Pain Split even under the effects of Heal Block.

Name: Sacred Fire
Effect: Has a 50% chance to burn the target; can be used while frozen which both attacks the target normally and thaws the user.

Name: Magnitude
Effect: Deals variable damage between 10 base power and 130 base power as well as double damage against Digging Pokemon.

Name: Dynamic Punch
Effect: Confuses the target.

Name: Megahorn
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Dragon Breath
Effect: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

Name: Baton Pass
Effect: The user returns to its party bypassing any trapping moves and Pursuit; it passes all stat modifiers (positive or negative including from Charge and Stockpile) as well as confusion Focus Energy/Lansat Berry boosts Ingrain Aqua Ring Embargo Gastro Acid Power Trick Magnet Rise Stockpiles Perish Song count Mist Leech Seed Ghost Curses Mind Reader Lock-On Block Mean Look Spider Web and Substitute to the replacement Pokemon.

Name: Encore
Effect: The target is forced to use its last attack for the next 3 turns. The effects of this move will end immediately if the target runs out of PP for the repeated attack. In double battles a Pokemon who has received an Encore will target a random opponent with single-target attacks.

Name: Pursuit
Effect: If the target switches out on the current turn this move strikes with doubled power before the switch. Baton Passers still escape safely. When a faster Pokemon uses Pursuit against a U-Turner the U-Turner is hit for normal damage; when a slower Pokemon uses Pursuit against a U-Turner the U-Turner makes its attack then is hit by Pursuit for double power and switches out.

Name: Rapid Spin
Effect: Removes Spikes Stealth Rock Toxic Spikes and Leech Seed from the user's side of the field; also frees the user from Bind Clamp Fire Spin Magma Storm Sand Tomb Whirlpool and Wrap. These effects do not occur if the move misses or is used against Ghost-type Pokemon.

Name: Sweet Scent
Effect: Lowers the target's Evasion by 1 stage.

Name: Iron Tail
Effect: Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Metal Claw
Effect: Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Attack by 1 stage.

Name: Vital Throw
Effect: This move usually goes last. It ignores Evasion and Accuracy modifiers and never misses except against Protect Detect or a target in the middle of Dig Fly Dive or Bounce.

Name: Morning Sun
Effect: Restores a fraction of the user's max HP depending on the weather: 2/3 during Sunny Day 1/2 during regular weather and 1/4 during Rain Dance Hail and Sandstorm.

Name: Synthesis
Effect: Restores a fraction of the user's max HP depending on the weather: 2/3 during Sunny Day 1/2 during regular weather and 1/4 during Rain Dance Hail and Sandstorm.

Name: Moonlight
Effect: Restores a fraction of the user's max HP depending on the weather: 2/3 during Sunny Day 1/2 during regular weather and 1/4 during Rain Dance Hail and Sandstorm.

Name: Hidden Power
Effect: Varies in power and type depending on the user's IVs; maximum 70 BP.

Name: Cross Chop
Effect: Has a high critical hit ratio.

Name: Twister
Effect: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch; power doubles while the target is in mid-air via Fly or Bounce.

Name: Rain Dance
Effect: Cancels all other weather moves. For 5 turns: the power of Water attacks is increased by 50% the power of Fire attacks is decreased by 50% Thunder never misses and has a 30% chance to hit through Protect and Detect the power of Solarbeam is halved and the healing power of Morning Sun Synthesis and Moonlight is decreased from 1/2 to 1/4 of the user's max HP. The effects of Rain Dance will last for eight turns if its user is holding Damp Rock.

Name: Sunny Day
Effect: Cancels all other weather moves. For 5 turns: freezing is prevented the power of Fire attacks is increased by 50% the power of Water attacks is decreased by 50% Solarbeam fires immediately Thunder becomes 50% accurate and the healing power of Morning Sun Synthesis and Moonlight is increased from 1/2 to 2/3 of the user's max HP. The effects of Sunny Day will last for eight turns if its user is holding Heat Rock.

Name: Crunch
Effect: Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Mirror Coat
Effect: Almost always goes last; if an opponent strikes with a Special attack before the user's turn the user retaliates for twice the damage it had endured. In double battles this attack targets the last opponent to hit the user with a Special attack and cannot hit the user's teammate.

Name: Psych Up
Effect: The user copies all six of the target's current stat modifiers.

Name: Extreme Speed
Effect: Usually goes first.

Name: Ancient Power
Effect: Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats by 1 stage.

Name: Shadow Ball
Effect: Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Future Sight
Effect: This move even if the user and/or the target switch out will strike the active target at the end of the second turn after its use. Only one instance of Future Sight or Doom Desire may be active at a time.

Name: Rock Smash
Effect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Whirlpool
Effect: Traps the target for 5-6 turns causing damage equal to 1/16 of its max HP each turn; this trapped effect can be broken by Rapid Spin. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-Turn. Base power also doubles when performed against a Pokemon in the middle of using Dive.

Name: Beat Up
Effect: Each healthy (i.e. not fainted nor inflicted with a status condition) Pokemon in your party contributes a typeless 10 base power hit determined solely by their base Attack and Defense stats.

Name: Fake Out
Effect: If this is the user's first move after being sent or switched into battle the target flinches; this move fails otherwise and against targets with Inner Focus.

Name: Uproar
Effect: The user causes an Uproar and attacks uncontrollably for 3 turns. During the effects of the Uproar active Pokemon cannot fall asleep and sleeping Pokemon sent into battle will wake up.

Name: Stockpile
Effect: Can be used up to three times to power Spit Up or Swallow. Also raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage each. Stockpiles and the defensive boosts are lost when these Swallow or Spit Up is used or the user switches out. However the boosts can be Baton Passed.

Name: Spit Up
Effect: Power increases with user's Stockpile count; fails with zero Stockpiles.

Name: Swallow
Effect: This move only works if the user has at least one Stockpile. Restores 1/4 of user's max HP with one Stockpile 1/2 of user's max HP with two Stockpiles and fully restores the user's HP with three Stockpiles.

Name: Heat Wave
Effect: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

Name: Hail
Effect: Cancels all other weather moves. For 5 turns: Blizzard never misses and has a 30% chance to hit through Protect and Detect each active Pokemon even when protected by a Substitute loses 1/16 of its max HP unless it is an Ice-type the power of Solarbeam is halved and the healing power of Morning Sun Synthesis and Moonlight is halved. The effects of Hail will last for eight turns if its user is holding Icy Rock.

Name: Torment
Effect: Prevents the target from using the same move for two turns in a row until the target is switched out. The target will use Struggle every other turn if it cannot attack without using the same move.

Name: Flatter
Effect: Confuses the target and raises its Special Attack by 1 stage.

Name: Will-O-Wisp
Effect: Burns the target. This move activates Flash Fire.

Name: Memento
Effect: The user sacrifices itself to lower the target's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages each.

Name: Facade
Effect: Power doubles if the user is inflicted with burn paralysis or poison.

Name: Focus Punch
Effect: At the beginning of the round the user tightens its focus; the attack itself usually goes last and will fail if the user is attacked by any other Pokemon during the turn.

Name: Smelling Salts
Effect: If the target is paralyzed power is doubled but the target will be cured.

Name: Follow Me
Effect: Almost always goes first. For the rest of the turn all attacks from the opponent's team that target the user's team are redirected toward the user. In double battles the user's teammate will not be protected from attacks that have more than one intended target.

Name: Nature Power
Effect: The user generates another move depending on the battle's current terrain. It generates Seed Bomb in any type of grass (as well as in puddles) Hydro Pump while surfing on top of water Rock Slide on any rocky outdoor terrain and inside of caves Earthquake on beach sand desert sand and dirt paths (as well as Wifi) Blizzard in snow and Tri Attack everywhere else. In Battle Revolution the move generates Tri Attack at Courtyard Main Street and Neon Seed Bomb at Sunny Park and Waterfall Hydro Pump at Gateway Rock Slide at Crystal Magma and Stargazer and Earthquake at Sunset.

Name: Charge
Effect: Doubles the power of the user's Electric attacks on the next turn and increases the user's Special Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Taunt
Effect: Prevents the target from using non-damaging moves for 3 turns. Assist Copycat Me First Metronome Mirror Move and Sleep Talk are prevented during this time but Bide Counter Endeavor Metal Burst and Mirror Coat are not prevented.

Name: Helping Hand
Effect: Always goes first. In double battles the power of the user's partner's attacks is increased by 1.5x for that turn; does nothing in single battles.

Name: Trick
Effect: Exchanges items with the target unless it has Sticky Hold or Multitype. Items lost to this move cannot be recovered by using Recycle.

Name: Role Play
Effect: The user's own ability is overwritten with the target's ability; does nothing if the target's ability is Wonder Guard.

Name: Wish
Effect: At the end of the next turn the active Pokemon from the user's team is healed by 1/2 of the user's HP; this can be any member of the user's team.

Name: Assist
Effect: The user performs a random move from any of the Pokemon on its team. Assist cannot generate itself Chatter Copycat Counter Covet Destiny Bond Detect Endure Feint Focus Punch Follow Me Helping Hand Me First Metronome Mimic Mirror Coat Mirror Move Protect Sketch Sleep Talk Snatch Struggle Switcheroo Thief or Trick.

Name: Ingrain
Effect: The user recovers 1/16 of its max HP after each turn but it cannot be switched out or forced to switch out. If a Flying-type Pokemon or a Pokemon with Levitate comes under the effect of Ingrain it will no longer have immunity from Ground-type attacks.

Name: Superpower
Effect: Lowers the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage each after use.

Name: Magic Coat
Effect: Almost always goes first. Until the end of the turn the user will reflect one disabling move back at its user (including teammates); these include status effect inducers confusion inducers (including Flatter and Swagger) Attract trapping moves that do not damage Leech Seed Worry Seed Gastro Acid and negative stat modifiers (except Defog). In double battles Magic Coat will only reflect the first applicable move performed against its user before wearing off.

Name: Recycle
Effect: The user's lost item is recovered. Items lost to Bug Bite Fling Natural Gift and Pluck will be recovered if the user of Recycle was the item's original holder; items lost to Trick Switcheroo Thief Covet or Knock Off cannot be recovered.

Name: Revenge
Effect: Almost always goes last even after another Pokemon's Focus Punch; this move's base power doubles if the user is damaged before its turn.

Name: Brick Break
Effect: Reflect and Light Screen are removed from the target's field even if the attack misses or the target is a Ghost-type.

Name: Yawn
Effect: If the target stays in battle it falls asleep at the end of the next turn.

Name: Knock Off
Effect: Disables the target's held item unless it has Sticky Hold or Multitype. Items lost to this move cannot be recovered by using Recycle.

Name: Endeavor
Effect: Inflicts damage equal to the target's current HP Varthe user's current HP.

Name: Eruption
Effect: Base power decreases as the user's HP decreases.

Name: Skill Swap
Effect: The user exchanges abilities with the target; does not work if Wonder Guard is the ability of either the user or the target.

Name: Imprison
Effect: Until the user faints or switches out the opponent cannot select any moves that it has in common with the user. In double battles this move affects both opponents.

Name: Refresh
Effect: The user recovers from burn poison and paralysis.

Name: Grudge
Effect: The target's next move is set to 0 PP if it directly KOs the user.

Name: Snatch
Effect: Almost always goes first. Until the end of the turn the user will steal a supporting move from another Pokemon (including teammates). In double battles Snatch only steals the first applicable move performed by another Pokemon before wearing off.

Name: Secret Power
Effect: This move has a 30% chance to inflict a side effect depending on the battle's current terrain. The target may be put to sleep in any type of grass (or in puddles) its Attack may be lowered by 1 stage while surfing on any body of water its Speed may be lowered by 1 stage while on marshy terrain its Accuracy may be lowered by 1 stage on beach sand desert sand and dirt paths (and also in Wifi battles) it may flinch in caves or on rocky outdoor terrain it may become frozen on snowy terrain and it may become paralyzed everywhere else.

Name: Dive
Effect: On the first turn the user dives underwater becoming uncontrollable and evades all attacks except for Surf and Whirlpool which have doubled power; the user may also be hit underwater if it was previously targeted by Lock-On or Mind Reader or if it is attacked by a Pokemon with No Guard. On the second turn the user attacks.

Name: Arm Thrust
Effect: Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice a 3/8 chance to hit three times a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times. If the user of this move has Skill Link this move will always strike five times.

Name: Camouflage
Effect: The user's type changes according to the current terrain. It becomes Grass-type in tall grass and very tall grass (as well as in puddles) Water-type while surfing on any body of water Rock-type while inside any caves or on any rocky terrain Ground-type on beach sand desert sand and dirt roads Ice-type in snow and Normal-type everywhere else. The user will always become Normal-type during Wi-Fi battles.

Name: Tail Glow
Effect: Raises the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.

Name: Luster Purge
Effect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Mist Ball
Effect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

Name: Feather Dance
Effect: Lowers the target's Attack by 2 stages.

Name: Teeter Dance
Effect: Each active Pokemon except the user becomes confused.

Name: Blaze Kick
Effect: Has a high critical hit ratio and a 10% chance to burn the target.

Name: Mud Sport
Effect: All Electric-type moves are 50% weaker until the user switches out.

Name: Ice Ball
Effect: The user attacks uncontrollably for five turns; this move's power doubles after each turn and also if Defense Curl was used beforehand. Its power resets after five turns have ended or if the attack misses.

Name: Needle Arm
Effect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Name: Slack Off
Effect: Restores 1/2 of the user's max HP.

Name: Hyper Voice
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Poison Fang
Effect: Has a 30% chance to inflict Toxic poison on the target.

Name: Crush Claw
Effect: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.

Name: Blast Burn
Effect: The user recharges during its next turn; as a result until the end of the next turn the user becomes uncontrollable.

Name: Hydro Cannon
Effect: The user recharges during its next turn; as a result until the end of the next turn the user becomes uncontrollable.

Name: Meteor Mash
Effect: Has a 20% chance to raise the user's Attack by 1 stage.

Name: Astonish
Effect: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Name: Weather Ball
Effect: Base power is 50; Base power doubles and move's type changes during weather effects: becomes Fire-type during Sunny Day Water-type during Rain Dance Ice-type during Hail and Rock-type during Sandstorm.

Name: Aromatherapy
Effect: Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of status conditions. Lists every Pokemon that was healed and what status condition was cured.

Name: Fake Tears
Effect: Lowers the target's Special Defense by 2 stages.

Name: Air Cutter
Effect: Has a high critical hit ratio.

Name: Overheat
Effect: Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages after use.

Name: Odor Sleuth
Effect: Until the target faints or switches the user's Accuracy modifiers and the target's Evasion modifiers are ignored. Ghost-type targets also lose their immunities against Normal-type and Fighting-type moves.

Name: Rock Tomb
Effect: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 stage.

Name: Silver Wind
Effect: Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats by 1 stage.

Name: Metal Sound
Effect: Lowers the target's Special Defense by 2 stages.

Name: Grass Whistle
Effect: Puts the target to sleep.

Name: Tickle
Effect: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by 1 stage each.

Name: Cosmic Power
Effect: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage each.

Name: Water Spout
Effect: Base power decreases as the user's HP decreases.

Name: Signal Beam
Effect: Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

Name: Shadow Punch
Effect: Ignores Evasion and Accuracy modifiers and never misses except against Protect Detect or a target in the middle of Dig Fly Dive or Bounce.

Name: Extrasensory
Effect: Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

Name: Sky Uppercut
Effect: Also hits targets in mid-air via Fly or Bounce.

Name: Sand Tomb
Effect: Traps the target for 5-6 turns causing damage equal to 1/16 of its max HP each turn; this trapped effect can be broken by Rapid Spin. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-Turn.

Name: Sheer Cold
Effect: The target faints; doesn't work on higher-leveled Pokemon.

Name: Muddy Water
Effect: Lowers the target's Accuracy by 1 stage.

Name: Bullet Seed
Effect: Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice a 3/8 chance to hit three times a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times. If the user of this move has Skill Link this move will always strike five times.

Name: Aerial Ace
Effect: Ignores Evasion and Accuracy modifiers and never misses except against Protect Detect or a target in the middle of Dig Fly Dive or Bounce.

Name: Icicle Spear
Effect: Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice a 3/8 chance to hit three times a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times. If the user of this move has Skill Link this move will always strike five times.

Name: Iron Defense
Effect: Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.

Name: Block
Effect: As long as the user remains in battle the target cannot switch out unless it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass or U-Turn. The target will still be trapped if the user switches out by using Baton Pass.

Name: Howl
Effect: Raises the user's Attack by 1 stage.

Name: Dragon Claw
Effect: Deals damage with no additional effect.

Name: Frenzy Plant
Effect: The user recharges during its next turn; as a result until the end of the next turn the user becomes uncontrollable.

Name: Bulk Up
Effect: Raises the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage each.

Name: Bounce
Effect: On the first turn the user bounces into the air becoming uncontrollable and evades most attacks. Gust Twister Thunder and Sky Uppercut have normal accuracy against a mid-air Pokemon with Gust and Twister also gaining doubled power. The user may also be hit in mid-air if it was previously targeted by Lock-On or Mind Reader or if it is attacked by a Pokemon with No Guard. On the second turn the user descends and has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

Name: Mud Shot
Effect: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 stage.

Name: Poison Tail
Effect: Has a high critical hit ratio and a 10% chance to poison the target.

Name: Covet
Effect: Steals the target's held item unless the user is already holding an item or the target has Sticky Hold or Multitype. Recycle cannot recover the stolen item.

Name: Volt Tackle
Effect: The user receives 1/3 recoil damage; has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

Name: Magical Leaf
Effect: Ignores Evasion and Accuracy modifiers and never misses except against Protect Detect or a target in the middle of Dig Fly Dive or Bounce.

Name: Water Sport
Effect: All Fire-type moves are 50% weaker until the user switches out.

Name: Calm Mind
Effect: Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage each.

Name: Leaf Blade
Effect: Has a high critical hit ratio.

Name: Dragon Dance
Effect: Raises the user's Attack and Speed by 1 stage each.

Name: Rock Blast
Effect: Attacks 2-5 times in one turn; if one of these attacks breaks a target's Substitute the target will take damage for the rest of the hits. This move has a 3/8 chance to hit twice a 3/8 chance to hit three times a 1/8 chance to hit four times and a 1/8 chance to hit five times. If the user of this move has Skill Link this move will always strike five times.

Name: Shock Wave
Effect: Ignores Evasion and Accuracy modifiers and never misses except against Protect Detect or a target in the middle of Dig Fly Dive or Bounce.

Name: Water Pulse
Effect: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

Name: Doom Desire
Effect: This move even if the user and/or the target switch out will strike the active target at the end of the second turn after its use.  Only one instance of Doom Desire or Future Sight may be active at a time.

Name: Psycho Boost
Effect: Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages after use.
